definitions: member of the biological family that includes humans and their extinct ancestors
examples: Scientists discovered fossilized hominid footprints in volcanic ash
The museum displays several hominid skulls from different time periods

definitions: biological genus that includes modern humans and several extinct species
examples: Homo sapiens emerged approximately 300,000 years ago
The discovery of Homo naledi changed our understanding of evolution

definitions: quality of being uniform or similar throughout in composition or character
examples: The neighborhood's cultural homogeneity has decreased over the decades
Product homogeneity makes it difficult for brands to differentiate themselves

definitions: process of making things uniform or similar in composition, often by mixing or blending
examples: Milk homogenization prevents cream from separating at the top
Critics worry about cultural homogenization through global media influence

definitions: word that shares the same spelling or pronunciation with another but has different meanings
examples: The word 'bark' is a homonym with meanings related to dogs and trees
English learners often struggle with homonyms like 'right' and 'write'

definitions: irrational fear, hatred, or prejudice against homosexual people or homosexuality
examples: The organization works to combat homophobia in schools and workplaces
Many countries have implemented laws specifically addressing homophobia and discrimination

definitions: word pronounced the same as another word but differing in meaning and often spelling
examples: 'There,' 'their,' and 'they're' are common homophones in English
The teacher created exercises to help students distinguish between homophones

definitions: person who is sexually attracted to people of the same sex
examples: The civil rights movement included many homosexual activists fighting for equality
Medical professionals no longer classify homosexual orientation as a disorder

definitions: romantic or sexual attraction between people of the same sex or gender
examples: Many societies have changed their attitudes toward homosexuality over recent decades
Research shows homosexuality exists throughout the animal kingdom as well

definitions: fine-grained stone used for sharpening cutting tools and instruments
examples: The barber used a leather hone to sharpen his straight razor
This Japanese water hone produces an exceptionally sharp edge on knives

definitions: quality of being truthful, sincere, and free from deceit or fraud
examples: Her honesty in admitting the mistake earned everyone's respect
The company values honesty and transparency in all business dealings

definitions: social flying insect that collects nectar and pollen to produce honey
examples: The honeybee colony can contain up to 60,000 individual bees
Farmers rely on honeybee pollination for many of their crops

definitions: structure of hexagonal wax cells built by bees to store honey
examples: The beekeeper carefully removed a honeycomb from the hive
Fresh honeycomb tastes sweet and has a unique waxy texture

definitions: pale green sweet melon with smooth skin and light flesh
sweet sticky substance secreted by aphids and other insects
examples: The fruit salad contained chunks of refreshing honeydew melon
She chose a ripe honeydew by checking for a creamy yellow color
Ants often farm aphids to harvest their honeydew secretions
The leaves were sticky with honeydew from the aphid infestation

definitions: vacation taken by newlyweds immediately after their wedding
initial period of enthusiasm or harmony in a new situation
examples: They spent their honeymoon exploring the beaches of Hawaii
The couple saved for years to afford their dream honeymoon
The honeymoon period with the new manager lasted about three months
Every presidency experiences a political honeymoon before criticism begins

definitions: climbing plant with tubular fragrant flowers that produce sweet nectar
examples: The honeysuckle vine covered the old fence with fragrant white blooms
Children often taste the sweet nectar from honeysuckle flowers

definitions: offensive slang term used to refer to a white person
examples: The outdated slur honky appeared in some 1970s movies
Using racial terms like honky creates unnecessary division and hurt

definitions: person who receives an honor, award, or special recognition
examples: The honoree gave a touching speech at the awards ceremony
Each honoree received a plaque commemorating their years of service

definitions: title or word expressing respect, used before or instead of someone's name
examples: In Japanese, the honorific 'san' is added after a person's name
Military honorifics like 'General' or 'Admiral' indicate rank and respect

definitions: act of showing respect or recognition to someone or something
examples: The ceremony honoring veterans takes place every November
They showed their honoring of tradition through the ancient ritual

definitions: high respect, esteem, or reverence accorded to someone or something
examples: It's an honour to receive this prestigious award tonight
The soldier served with honour and distinction throughout her career

definitions: act of showing respect or recognition to someone or something
examples: The honouring of local heroes happens at the annual town festival
Their honouring of ancestral customs keeps cultural traditions alive

definitions: illegally made or inferior quality alcoholic liquor, especially moonshine
examples: During Prohibition, people made hooch in hidden basement stills
The homemade hooch burned going down but got the job done

definitions: covering for the head and neck, often attached to a coat
hinged metal covering over a vehicle's engine
informal term for neighborhood, especially in urban areas
examples: She pulled her jacket's hood up against the rain
The winter coat featured a fur-lined hood for extra warmth
The mechanic lifted the hood to check the engine oil
Smoke began pouring from under the car's hood
He grew up in the hood but earned a college scholarship
Everyone in the hood knows Mrs. Johnson's corner store

definitions: person who engages in crime and violence, especially as a gang member
examples: The hoodlum threatened shopkeepers who refused to pay protection money
Police arrested several hoodlums after the street fight broke out

definitions: traditional African American folk magic and spiritual practices
tall thin spire of rock formed by erosion
examples: She learned hoodoo remedies and rituals from her grandmother
The shop sells hoodoo supplies like roots, oils, and candles
The red rock hoodoo formations create an otherworldly landscape
Bryce Canyon contains thousands of distinctive hoodoo rock pillars

definitions: hard covering that protects the foot of certain animals like horses
examples: The farrier trimmed and shaped each hoof before fitting new horseshoes
The horse's hoof struck sparks against the rocky mountain trail

definitions: device for smoking tobacco or other substances through water-cooled smoke
examples: The group shared a hookah filled with flavored tobacco at the lounge
Traditional hookah pipes often feature ornate glass and metal designs

definitions: person who engages in sexual activity for payment
middle forward player in rugby who hooks the ball in scrums
examples: The documentary explored the dangerous lives of street hookers
Social workers provide health services and support to hookers
The team's hooker successfully won possession in most scrums
A good hooker needs flexibility and strong core muscles

definitions: action of catching, connecting, or attaching something with or as with a hook
examples: The hooking of the trailer to the truck took several attempts
Her hooking technique in crochet creates perfectly even stitches

definitions: casual sexual encounter or relationship without commitment
connection between equipment, systems, or utilities
examples: The dating app facilitates hookups rather than long-term relationships
Their hookup lasted one night and they never spoke again
The RV park offers full hookups including water, electric, and sewer
Check the cable hookup before calling the technician for help

definitions: unauthorized absence from school or work, especially to have fun
examples: The teenagers played hooky to go to the beach
Getting caught playing hooky resulted in detention for a week

definitions: violent young troublemaker, typically one of a gang
examples: Soccer hooligans caused damage to the stadium after the match
The group of hooligans vandalized several shops downtown last night

definitions: violent or rowdy behavior, especially by gangs of young troublemakers
examples: The city implemented strict measures to combat football hooliganism
Hooliganism at concerts led to increased security and age restrictions

definitions: circular band of metal, wood, or similar material
examples: The basketball swooshed through the hoop for three points
Children rolled wooden hoops down the street in the old game

definitions: exclamation used to express joy, approval, or triumph
examples: The crowd shouted hooray when the home team scored
Hooray for the weekend, time to relax and unwind

definitions: low wavering cry made by owls
person or thing that is very amusing
examples: The barn owl's haunting hoot echoed through the night
We heard the hoot of a great horned owl from the forest
Your grandmother is such a hoot at family gatherings
The comedy show was an absolute hoot from start to finish

definitions: light springy jump or series of jumps on one foot
climbing plant whose flowers are used to flavor beer
examples: The rabbit moved forward with a quick hop
Children played hopscotch, taking turns with each hop
The brewery sources premium hops from the Pacific Northwest
Different hop varieties give beer unique flavors and aromas

definitions: person who hopes or is likely to succeed at something
examples: The young hopeful auditioned for the lead role in the play
Political hopefuls gathered at the convention to launch their campaigns

definitions: container used for storing and dispensing bulk materials
insect that moves by jumping, such as a grasshopper
examples: The grain hopper feeds wheat into the mill at a steady rate
Fill the coffee hopper with fresh beans every morning
The grass hopper landed on the picnic blanket
These tiny leaf hoppers can damage garden plants significantly

definitions: large group of people, especially when considered as moving together
examples: A horde of tourists descended upon the small coastal town
The shopping mall was invaded by hordes of bargain hunters

definitions: line or plane that is parallel to the horizon or ground
examples: Draw a horizontal line across the middle of the page
The carpenter checked that the shelf was perfectly horizontal

definitions: large wasp that lives in colonies and can sting repeatedly
examples: A hornet nest in the attic required professional removal
The angry hornet chased us away from the apple tree

definitions: forecast of a person's future based on the positions of stars and planets
examples: She reads her daily horoscope in the newspaper every morning
The astrologer prepared a detailed horoscope based on birth information

definitions: back of a horse as a place to ride
examples: They explored the mountain trails on horseback for hours
Learning to ride horseback requires balance and confidence
